page.title: 11FARMING IN THE BALFRON AREA
page.content: The farms in the area are all{mixed {livestock farms,}with two specialising in dairy farming and one in the production of pigs. The average size of farm is approximately 100 hectares. {Crops}are grown mainly to feed the livestock i.e. the cattle and sheep on each farm. The main cereal crop in the district is barley and most of the area is in permanent grassland used for pasture or cut for silage or hay. Probably on account of the high rainfall, most farmers produce silage rather than hay. Over the past 20 years, the labour force on farms has been reduced, and much of the work e.g. lime-spreading, hedge-cutting, harvesting and sheep- shearing is now done by contractors. A large number of{trees}is in evidence on the farmland in the area and this provides work for the local sawmill.
